answers.answer: migraines do last long and have symptoms of nausea. what you could do is follow up with your md, at any visit your doc will do a bp, check weight, temp. pretty basic stuff. anemia is questionable at best.  family hx of high blood pressure, cholestorol, check for diabetes, age, weight.  any family hx of strokes or heart attacks. i personally would suggest an mri brain w/wo, ct brain is also a good start. lab work, f/u iron, cbc, bmp, lft.  let me say though, sounds more like migraines, however if there is family hx, get checked. if ok, every 6 mos or so fu.

question: I'm wondering about potential causes for the following set of symptoms:I've been getting intermittent headaches for weeks - usually on the right side, behind my eye near my temple.  The pain can radiate to other areas of my head.  In addition, the headaches can be preceded (or followed) by waves of nausea.  Basically, going back and forth between head pain and nausea, not always at the same time.  There are also periods where I feel just fine.The pain is not debilitating - just irritating.  So is the nausea.I also have a history of iron deficient anemia, but I believe my counts are good right now as I have been diligent with my iron therapy as of late.Any ideas?  Do migraines last this long?
title: Headaches/waves of nausea
